com.smartnsoft.droid4me.cache
Class Persistence

java.lang.Object
  com.smartnsoft.droid4me.cache.Persistence
All Implemented Interfaces:
Business.InputStreamer<java.lang.String,Persistence.PersistenceException>, Business.IOStreamer<java.lang.String,Persistence.PersistenceException>, Business.OutputStreamer<java.lang.String,Persistence.PersistenceException>
Direct Known Subclasses:
DbPersistence, FilePersistence, NullPersistence
public abstract class Persistence
extends java.lang.Object
implements Business.IOStreamer<java.lang.String,Persistence.PersistenceException>

Enables to store persistently on the internal/external device "hard-drive" some contents.

Since:
2009.03.26
Author:
ï¿½douard Mercier

Nested Class Summary
static class Persistence.PersistenceException
          The exception thrown when an error occurs during a persistence operation.
protected static class Persistence.UriUsage
          Defined in order to count how many times an URI has been consumed.
protected static class Persistence.UriUsages
          Used by the classes overriding the Persistence class, so as to keep track of how many time each persisted URI has been accessed.

Field Detail

log

protected static final Logger log

CACHE_DIRECTORY_PATHS

public static java.lang.String[] CACHE_DIRECTORY_PATHS
The directory paths of the instances.

The number of elements in this array must be equal to INSTANCES_COUNT.

INSTANCES_COUNT

public static int INSTANCES_COUNT
The number of instances.

IMPLEMENTATION_FQN

public static java.lang.String IMPLEMENTATION_FQN
The fully qualified name of the Persistence instances implementation.

MAXIMUM_URI_CONTENTS_SIZE_IN_BYTES

public static int MAXIMUM_URI_CONTENTS_SIZE_IN_BYTES
The maximum size, expressed in bytes, of the data associated to an URI.

Think of tuning this parameter in case the application stores large data.

uriUsages

protected final Persistence.UriUsages uriUsages
Indicates how the persisted URI are being accessed.

beingProcessed

protected final java.util.Set<java.lang.String> beingProcessed
Holds all the URIs which are currently being persisted.

Constructor Detail

Persistence

protected Persistence(java.lang.String storageDirectoryPath,
                      int instanceIndex)
The unique constructor.

The initialize() method does not need to be explicitly invoked before using the instance, as long as the XXXInstance methods are not invoked, because the other methods will invoke it.

Parameters:
storageDirectoryPath - the location where the persistence should be performed
instanceIndex - the ordinal of the instance which is bound to be created. Starts with 0.
See Also:
initialize()
Method Detail

storeInputStream

public static java.io.InputStream storeInputStream(java.io.OutputStream outputStream,
                                                   java.io.InputStream inputStream,
                                                   boolean closeInput,
                                                   java.lang.String logMessageSuffix)
Parameters:
outputStream - it is closed by this method

getInstance

public static Persistence getInstance()
Equivalent to calling getInstance(0).

getInstance

public static Persistence getInstance(int position)
Enables to access the various persistence instances. The number of instantiated occurrences is defined by the INSTANCES_COUNT variable, which must have been set beforehand.

This will cause the initialize() method to be invoked for every instance.

Note that the instantiation is lazy.

Throws:
Persistence.PersistenceException - in case a problem occurred while initializing the persistence

setStorageBackendAvailable

protected final void setStorageBackendAvailable(boolean storageBackendAvailable)
Indicates whether the underlying back-end storage is available.

Parameters:
storageBackendAvailable - true if and only if the back-end storage is available

isInitialized

public final boolean isInitialized()
Returns:
true if and only if the current instance is currently initialized

getStorageDirectoryPath

public final java.lang.String getStorageDirectoryPath()
Returns:
the directory path of the persistence provided in the constructor

initialize

public final void initialize()
                      throws Persistence.PersistenceException
Initializes the persistence instance. If the instance is already initialized, the method does nothing.

It will be lazily invoked when the object is used for the first time when using the getInstance(int) method.

Throws:
Persistence.PersistenceException - if something went wrong during the initialization

initializeInstance

protected abstract void initializeInstance()
                                    throws Persistence.PersistenceException
Is responsible for performing the initialize() method job.

The implementation must set the storageBackendAvailable flag accordingly.

Throws:
Persistence.PersistenceException - if something went wrong during the initialization

getUris

public final java.util.List<java.lang.String> getUris()
                                               throws Persistence.PersistenceException
Enables to access all the stored URIs. Each persistent entry is represented by a a local URI, and this method returns all of them.

Note that the ordering of the returned list is not guaranteed to be stable.

Returns:
the list of the stored URIs stored in the persistence instance
Throws:
Persistence.PersistenceException - in case an error occurred while computing the URIs or if the storage back-end is not available
See Also:
getUrisInstance()

getUrisInstance

protected abstract java.util.List<java.lang.String> getUrisInstance()
                                                             throws Persistence.PersistenceException
Is responsible for performing the getUris() method job.

Returns:
the list of the stored URIs stored in the persistence instance
Throws:
Persistence.PersistenceException - in case an error occurred while computing the URIs
See Also:
getUris()

getLastUpdate

public final java.util.Date getLastUpdate(java.lang.String uri)
                                   throws Persistence.PersistenceException
Indicates the latest update timestamp corresponding to an URI persistent entry.

Specified by:
getLastUpdate in interface Business.InputStreamer<java.lang.String,Persistence.PersistenceException>
Parameters:
uri - an URI which identifies the resource; it is not allowed to be null
Returns:
the date when the underlying persistent entry has been updated ; null if no persistent entry exists for the provided URI
Throws:
Persistence.PersistenceException - in case an error occurred while processing the request or if the storage back-end is not available

extractInputStream

public final Business.InputAtom extractInputStream(java.lang.String uri)
                                            throws Persistence.PersistenceException
Is responsible for extracting an input stream from the persistence related to the provided URI.

Parameters:
uri - the URI which identifies the stream to extract
Returns:
null if and only if there is no data associated to the given URI; otherwise, its related wrapped input stream is returned
Throws:
Persistence.PersistenceException - in case an error occurred while extracting the input stream or if the storage back-end is not available
See Also:
#readInputStreamInstance(), #readInputStream()

flushInputStream

public final Business.InputAtom flushInputStream(java.lang.String uri,
                                                 Business.InputAtom inputAtom)
                                          throws Persistence.PersistenceException
Is responsible for writing persistently the stream related to the given URI.

Beware: the Business.InputAtom#inputStream of the provided parameter is consumed by the method!

Parameters:
uri - the URI which identifies the stream to persist
inputAtom - the wrapper which contains the stream to write
Returns:
a new stream wrapper, which is operational, and in particular not
Throws:
Persistence.PersistenceException - if a problem occurred while persisting the data or if the storage back-end is not available
See Also:
#flushInputStreamInstance()

writeInputStream

public final java.io.InputStream writeInputStream(java.lang.String uri,
                                                  Business.InputAtom inputAtom)
                                           throws Persistence.PersistenceException
Description copied from interface: Business.OutputStreamer
Is responsible for writing the persist the provided data.

Specified by:
writeInputStream in interface Business.OutputStreamer<java.lang.String,Persistence.PersistenceException>
Parameters:
uri - the URI the data belongs to
inputAtom - the wrapper that contains the data to be persisted the Business.InputAtom.inputStream is allowed to be null: in that case, a null-like object must be persisted
Returns:
a valid input stream corresponding to the persisted data; it is not allowed to be null
Throws:
Persistence.PersistenceException - if a problem occurred while writing the data or if the storage back-end is not available

                  throws Persistence.PersistenceException
Description copied from interface: Business.IOStreamer
Is responsible for removing any data related to the provided URI. A further attempt to access to this same URI should be a failure.

clearInstance

protected abstract void clearInstance()
                               throws Persistence.PersistenceException
Empties the persistence.

Once called, the persistence storage will be emptied, but the instance can keep on being used as is.

Throws:
if - any problem occurs while emptying the persistence
Persistence.PersistenceException
See Also:
clear()

closeInstance

protected abstract void closeInstance()
                               throws Persistence.PersistenceException
Closes the persistence.

Once called, the persistence will need to be initialized again, before being used.

Throws:
if - any problem occurs while closing the persistence
Persistence.PersistenceException
See Also:
close()

clear

public final void clear()
                 throws Persistence.PersistenceException
Totally clears the cache related to the current instance. This will delete all the entries. The method will invoke the clearInstance() method.

Once cleared, the current instance can be used as is.

Throws:
if - any problem occurs while clearing the persistence
Persistence.PersistenceException
See Also:
clearInstance(), close(), clearAll()

close

public final void close()
                 throws Persistence.PersistenceException
Closes the current instance. The method will invoke the closeInstance() method.

Once closed, the current instance cannot be used until an explicit initialize() call is performed.

Throws:
Persistence.PersistenceException
See Also:
closeInstance(), clear(), closeAll()

clearAll

public static void clearAll()
                     throws Persistence.PersistenceException
Clears all persistence instances. The method will invoke the clear() on each instance.

Throws:
Persistence.PersistenceException

closeAll

public static void closeAll()
                     throws Persistence.PersistenceException
Closes all persistence instances. The method will invoke the close() on each instance.

Throws:
Persistence.PersistenceException
